result.execSummary:
The defendant Deanna L. Ruppert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deanna L. Ruppert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deanna L. Ruppert was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Associated with Charge #3

3:10 p.m. Defendant Deanna L. Ruppert in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 16cm122, 16tr3334 and 16tr647. Schiek states agreement/Bennett concurs. State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 2 in 16cm122, 16tr3334 and 16tr647 in entirety - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Bennett/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years
Fine - $1744 plus blood draw surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Jail - 45 days with Huber for all purposes. May serve in Oneida County or Langlade County jail. To commence on/before May 26, 2016 at 8:00 a.m. 
Driver's license revoked - 24 months
IID - 24 months
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA Assessment and Driver's Safety Plan
Jail credit - 6 days if revoked
Any other conditions/Counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Must report to probation by or before April 26, 2017
Appeal rights given. Payment plan given.
Adj. 3:23 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

In 16cm329:
State moves to amend Count 1 to Operate with restricted substance (THC) - 2nd offense - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Bennett/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Fine - $1429 plus blood draw surcharge
Jail - 5 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before 12-16-16 at 8:00 a.m. 
Jail credit - 3 days
Driver's License revocation - 12 months
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA Asssessment
Appeal rights given. Payment Plan application given.
